bioghist.p: Helen Oakes has studied and been involved in the Philadelphia school system since the 1960s. She played active roles in many organizations committed to improving and restoring public education including the Citizens Committee on Public Education in Philadelphia and the West Philadelphia Schools Committee. Mrs. Oakes was appointed to the Board of Education in Philadelphia in 1982 and served as a member until 1989. While on the Board of Education, she worked as a member of the Desegregation Task Force and the Task Force on Teacher Selection. Mrs. Oakes also wrote and published The Oakes Newsletter for nineteen years from 1970 to 1989.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains papers related to Helen Oakes' involvement with variety of educational institutions and issues. Board of Education subject files address a wide range of topics, including AIDS, dropouts, charter schools, attendance, affirmative action, effective schools, pregnancy prevention, school reorganization, superintendent selection, the Educational Home Rule Charter. Subject files include articles, printed reports, studies, statistics, and some memoranda and correspondence. There are also records related to the compilation of School-by-School Statistical Analysis of Philadelphia's Public Schools, 1965, 1975-1981, as well as printed School District of Philadelphia directories, financial reports, policies, and teaching guides. The collection also contains newspaper clippings, 1964-2002, and records related to Oakes' reelection to the Board of Education. Rhoads Elementary School files include notes from classroom observations and from staff meetings and discussions with staff, reports, copies of mailings to parents and memos to staff, and correspondence from staff members to Oakes. The files related to The Oakes Newsletter include mailing lists, accounting information, tax forms, incoming and outgoing correspondence, reference materials for articles, notes on classroom observations and notes from discussions with educators. The collection includes files related to organizations with which Oakes was involved such as the Council for Educational Priorities, Citizen's Committee on Public Education, Philadelphia Voter Education Project, and the League of Women Voter's Education Committee. These files include minutes, printed materials, and memoranda. There are some records in the collection related to the sale of the papers of Floyd Logan, founder and president of the Educational Equality League.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
